1.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
near, with or among; often in general, to

2.brief: a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
near, with or among; often in general, to
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
to prophesy, i.e. speak (or sing) by inspiration (in prediction or simple discourse)
near, with or among; often in general, to

a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)

lo!

to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement
properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)
an elevation

to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, a log (as round); by implication, an idol

properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a carcase (as limp), whether of man or beast; figuratively, an idolatrous image

a seat; figuratively, a site; abstractly, a session; by extension an abode (the place or the time); by implication, population
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)

to be guilty; by implication to be punished or perish
to repose, i.e. desist from exertion; used in many implied relations (causative, figurative or specific)
properly, a log (as round); by implication, an idol
to fell a tree; generally, to destroy anything
properly, to stroke or rub; by implication, to erase; also to smooth (as if with oil), i.e. grease or make fat; also to touch, i.e. reach to

a bisection, i.e. (by implication) the centre
